overview_info.Subject:
Das Art Studies gehört zum Studienbereiche Kunst- und Design sciences, Kunstpädagogik der Fächergruppe Art, Music, Design.Weitere Informationen zur Fächergruppe Art, Music, Design.
                                                Art Studies

Annotation of the Higher Education Insti: Within the degree course, art and artistic practice in public spaces are explored and applied to social fields of action. Starting with subject-related academic and artistic analysis, the Master's degree course provides specific specialisation in different professional fields due to its three profile areas. In this way, connections are created to cultural educational fields of practice (e.g. day-care nurseries, art schools, independent full-day schools) in the first profile area of non-school cultural and educational work. The second area of teaching of art and media is oriented towards institutions which teach people about art (such as museums, galleries, cultural institutions). Artistic communication in a social context is the third profile area, which links into socially relevant fields, such as urban development projects, public health or developmental aid.The Master's degree opens up the opportunity to do a doctorate and, with the appropriate course planning/fulfilment of the relevant requirements, admission to any possible doctorate.The degree qualifies students for a broad professional spectrum, e.g. in day-care nurseries, art schools, institutions that teach art, museums, galleries, cultural institutions, for urban development projects, in public health or in developmental aid.

admission_reqs_info.Completion of first university degree: Bachelor/Bakkalaureus                                            (and other qualifications, provided that they are recognised as being equivalent)

tuition_fees_info.Annotation to the tuition fee: We are convinced that the tuition fees are not a cost, but rather an investment in your future. Nevertheless, it is important that you look at the tuition fees, the cost of living during your studies, and the different possibilities of funding.We will be glad to assist you with any questions you may have. The monthly tuition fees are currently EUR 690. You can pay them either monthly or annually in advance. In addition, all students currently pay an amount of EUR 67.70 per semester (as of: 2016) to the Karlsruhe student services.The semester fees including student services amount to EUR 4,207.70. If you complete your three-year course in the regular study period, the entire course will thus cost you a total of EUR 25,246.20.

Annotation of the Higher Education Insti: The Bachelor's degree in the multi-disciplinary dual-subject course of study qualifies students for entry into professional working life and, DEPENDING ON THE COURSE PLAN, for the Master's Teaching Qualification for Grammar Schools or admission to a subject-related Master's degree course\; e.g. the Master's in Art and Communication at Osnabrück University. Art education/art can be studied as part of a dual-subject Bachelor's degree course as a core subject in combination with another core subject (depending on the professional goal: English language and literature/English, biology, chemistry, education, Protestant theology/religion, geography, geoinformatics, German language and literature/German, history, computer science, Catholic theology/religion, art history, Latin, mathematics, musicology/music, philosophy, physics, political science, sociology, romance studies/French, Romance studies/Italian, Romance studies/Spanish, sports science/sport, environmental systems science or economics). It is also possible to combine art education/art as a major subject with one of the aforementioned subjects as a minor subject (with the exception of education, Latin, musicology/music, political science, sociology, environmental systems science and economics), or art education/art as a minor subject with the major subjects biology, chemistry, Protestant theology/religion, geography, mathematics or physics.Alongside the subject-related academic studies, an inter-disciplinary professional qualification area is completed which, depending on the career goal, comprises the core curriculum of teacher training (IKC) or the acquisition of key competencies based on the '4 Schritte + (4 steps+) model.

overview_info.Areas of Concentration: Art Education subject knowledge, Art Education subject-related didactics, Art Education professional practice

Annotation of the Higher Education Insti: At JLU, within the context of the humanities-based Bachelor's combination degree courses in History and Cultural Studies and Language, Literature and Culture, two to three subjects are always combined with one another. The study contents are thereby determined by the selected subjects and range from the description of languages and literatures, to the analysis of historical epochs and works of art, right through to information about legal framework conditions in German and international law.Information and events for prospective students are available at: www.uni-giessen.de/studium/askjustus

overview_info.Subject:
Das Art Pedagogy gehört zum Studienbereiche Kunst- und Design sciences, Kunstpädagogik der Fächergruppe Art, Music, Design.Weitere Informationen zur Fächergruppe Art, Music, Design.
                                                Art Pedagogy
overview_info.Areas of Concentration: Extracurricular art education/cultural activities, Communication of Art and Visual Media, Artistic Communication

Target group:
a) Main subject
Students with a Bachelor's Degree in Art Education, a Bachelor's Degree with a major in Art Education, and a Teacher of High Schools majoring in Art. Recognised as equivalent are: academic degrees in the subject areas Cultural Studies with focus on Art, Media Studies with focus on Art, Fine Arts and Art History, as well as related subject areas with artistic/aesthetic components. After individual consideration, the Examination Committee may recognise other courses as equivalent and take into account additional professional experience. In all cases the proof of artistic suitability must be provided by the passing of a portfolio examination in accordance with the order of proof of artistic suitability. 
b.) Minor subject
Students with a Bachelor's Degree in Art Education, a Multidisciplinary Bachelor's Degree with a major in Art Education, and a Teacher of High Schools majoring in Art. Recognised as equivalent are: academic degrees in the subject areas Cultural Studies with focus on Art, Media Studies with focus on Art, Fine Arts and Art History, as well as related subject areas with artistic/aesthetic components. After individual consideration, the Examination Committee may recognise other courses as equivalent and take into account additional professional experience. In all cases the proof of artistic suitability must be provided by the passing of a portfolio examination in accordance with the order of proof of artistic suitability.
Annotation of the Higher Education Insti: Study as major and minor subject possible. The course qualifies graduates for the field of extra-curricular artistic education/cultural work, the field of art instruction and visual media or the field of artistic communication.

admission_reqs_info.Completion of first university degree: Bachelor/Bakkalaureus                                            (and other qualifications, provided that they are recognised as being equivalent)
